title: Penguin Random House, Simon & Schuster Fire Back at U.S. Antitrust Lawsuit
sub_head: Publishers argue Justice Department challenge to their planned merger is baseless
body:
WASHINGTON—Penguin Random House and Simon & Schuster filed their first court response Monday to a Justice Department antitrust lawsuit challenging their planned merger, arguing their deal would benefit authors, retailers and consumers.
The publishers said the department’s lawsuit was “factually wrong and legally baseless.”
